ai-snp3.4:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Kosalan lands on the bank of the Sundarika river.
ai-snp3.4:1.3_0: Now at that time the brahmin Bhāradvāja of Sundarika was serving the sacred flame and performing the fire sacrifice on the bank of the river Sundarika.
ai-snp3.4:1.4_0: Then he looked all around the four directions, wondering,
ai-snp3.4:1.5_0: “Now who might eat the leftovers of this offering?”
ai-snp3.4:1.6_0: He saw the Buddha meditating at the root of a certain tree with his robe pulled over his head.
ai-snp3.4:1.7_0: Taking the leftovers of the offering in his left hand and a pitcher in the right he approached the Buddha.
ai-snp3.4:2.2_0: Then Sundarika the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Bark Robe
ai-snp3.4:2.3_0: “This shaven, this Muṇḍa wanted to turn back.”
ai-snp3.4:2.5_0: “Some brahmins are shaven, Why don’t I ask about his birth?”
ai-snp3.4:2.6_0: Then the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja went to the Fortunate One,
ai-snp3.4:2.6_1: and after going, he said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-snp3.4:2.7_0: “Sir, in what caste were you born?”
ai-snp3.4:3.1_0: Then the Buddha addressed Sundarika in verse:
ai-snp3.4:4.4_0: having nothing, I wander in the world,
ai-snp3.4:5.3_0: Which is learned, don’t pass here.
ai-snp3.4:5.4_0: Do you ask me about it?”
ai-snp3.4:7.2_0: And you call me a brahmin, not a brahmin.
ai-snp3.4:7.4_0: it is twenty-four hundred thousand leagues.”
ai-snp3.4:8.2_0: nobles, and brahmins, here in the world,
ai-snp3.4:8.3_0: offered many sacrifices to the gods?”
ai-snp3.4:9.1_0: “A knowledge master who has crossed the flood
ai-snp3.4:10.3_0: since I have met such a knowledge master!
ai-snp3.4:10.4_0: It’s because I’d never met anyone like you
ai-snp3.4:10.5_0: so another the people ate the full moon.”
ai-snp3.4:11.2_0: So I approached a teacher and asked:
ai-snp3.4:11.3_0: peaceful, unclouded, untroubled, with no need for hope,
ai-snp3.4:11.4_0: I am satisfied, make an end, I am intelligent.”
ai-snp3.4:12.1_0: “Master Gotama, I delight in the wilderness,
ai-snp3.4:12.2_0: a sacrificer who desires the sacrificial posts.
ai-snp3.4:12.4_0: I will tell you what is the sacrifice, and this is my last.”
ai-snp3.4:13.1_0: “Well then, brahmin, I will teach you the Dhamma for you.
ai-snp3.4:14.1_0: Do not ask about birth, nor about conduct,
ai-snp3.4:14.2_0: for any wood can surely generate fire.
ai-snp3.4:14.3_0: A steadfast sage, even though from a low class family,
ai-snp3.4:14.4_0: it is for one who understands it is related to conscience
ai-snp3.4:15.1_0: Tamed by truth, fulfilled by taming,
ai-snp3.4:15.2_0: With perfect understanding, (and) the spiritual life accomplished,
ai-snp3.4:15.4_0: A brahmin should sacrifice like this:
ai-snp3.4:16.1_0: Those who are praised by sensual pleasures
ai-snp3.4:16.4_0: A brahmin should sacrifice like this:
ai-snp3.4:17.1_0: Those who are free from passion,
ai-snp3.4:17.2_0: Like the moon released from the eclipse.
ai-snp3.4:17.4_0: A brahmin should sacrifice like this:
ai-snp3.4:18.1_0: wander in the world without transgression.
ai-snp3.4:18.4_0: A brahmin should sacrifice like this:
ai-snp3.4:19.1_0: One who has mastered sensual pleasures
ai-snp3.4:19.2_0: He who knows the mind is born,
ai-snp3.4:19.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:20.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:21.2_0: He who is free from lust, unselfish, not yearning,
ai-snp3.4:21.4_0: the brahmin who slandered the innocent,
ai-snp3.4:21.5_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:22.1_0: He who then gave him a residence.
ai-snp3.4:22.3_0: not grasping to this world or the next,
ai-snp3.4:22.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:23.2_0: Knowing the Dhamma, they attain ultimate conviction.
ai-snp3.4:23.3_0: with defilements ended, bearing the final body:
ai-snp3.4:23.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:24.2_0: are cleared and ended, they are no more.
ai-snp3.4:24.3_0: He is everywhere free in every respect,
ai-snp3.4:24.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:25.3_0: For the purpose of completely understanding suffering,
ai-snp3.4:25.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:26.2_0: attacked to the view of others.
ai-snp3.4:26.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:27.1_0: the one urgency in Dhamma after others,
ai-snp3.4:27.2_0: are cleared and ended, they are no more.
ai-snp3.4:27.3_0: the Buddha, having cut off the attachments,
ai-snp3.4:27.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:28.1_0: who sees the fetter of birth and death.
ai-snp3.4:28.2_0: * He who on the path to passion,
ai-snp3.4:28.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:29.2_0: immersed in samādhi, immersed in samādhi,
ai-snp3.4:29.3_0: She is undefeated, free of doubt,
ai-snp3.4:29.4_0: The Realised One is filled with flour.
ai-snp3.4:30.1_0: no danger for delusion in delusion,
ai-snp3.4:30.5_0: to this extent of your purity.
ai-snp3.4:31.2_0: Such a knowledge master is included in the meaning
ai-snp3.4:31.3_0: For the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha,
ai-snp3.4:32.1_0: “Food enchanted by a spell isn’t fit for me to eat.
ai-snp3.4:32.2_0: that is not the Dhamma, brahmin, of those who see,
ai-snp3.4:32.3_0: Buddhas reject what is gained through chanting verses,
ai-snp3.4:32.4_0: while Dhamma lasts, brahmin, this is their way of life.
ai-snp3.4:33.1_0: Serve with other food and drink
ai-snp3.4:33.2_0: the consummate one, the great hermit,
ai-snp3.4:33.3_0: with defilements ended and remorse stilled.
ai-snp3.4:33.4_0: For he is the field for the seeker of merit.”
ai-snp3.4:34.1_0: “I am, Blessed One! That is the one who has lost his perception,
ai-snp3.4:34.2_0: He who, out of a religious donation (other) may not attack one like me,
ai-snp3.4:34.3_0: when there is a time for seeking the sacrifice,
ai-snp3.4:34.4_0: We’ve come to understand the teaching.”
ai-snp3.4:35.1_0: “Speaks the wealth that has been done,
ai-snp3.4:36.1_0: The one whose mind is eager
ai-snp3.4:36.4_0: the sacrifice is offering to such ancestry,
ai-snp3.4:37.2_0: raise our joined palms to the Buddha,
ai-snp3.4:37.3_0: would not be venerated by food and drink,
ai-snp3.4:37.4_0: that’s how it is such a religious donation.”
ai-snp3.4:38.1_0: “Sir, the Buddha is filled with oil!
ai-snp3.4:38.3_0: Recipient of gifts from the whole world,
ai-snp3.4:38.4_0: what’s given to you is very fruitful.”
ai-snp3.4:39.3_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what was hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness
ai-snp3.4:39.3_1: so that one with eyes might see what’s there—
ai-snp3.4:39.3_2: just so has the Dhamma been made clear by reverend Gotama in more than one way.
ai-snp3.4:39.4_0: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-snp3.4:39.5_0: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”
ai-snp3.4:39.6_0: And the brahmin Sundarika Bhāradvāja clan ...
